III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 remarked to Complainant in front of Youth J that if Youth J
had hit her, Youth J would be on the floor implying a hypothetical
verbal threat.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Crisis Screener via phone. On 5/5/24 between 2pm
– 3pm she said she assessed Youth J at Garden City Hospital
Emergency Room, Bed 30. Crisis Screener said an unidentified
nurse told her Youth J was in two-point restraints because she hit
Staff 1.. Staff 1 said to Crisis Screener that if Youth J had hit her,
Youth J would have been knocked on the floor.
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 5/5/24. She did not
have any additional information to provide.
I notified Foster Care Worker of the investigation assignment.
She expressed no licensing concerns.
I interviewed Youth J at the facility on 5/7/24 with Rights Officer
present. She has been at Vista Maria for one day and had been
at Garden City Hospital for four days for psychiatric reasons
before that. Youth J presented with a flat affect and was easily
distracted by noises outside of the room. I pulled the door shut to
help her focus and to decrease the external stimuli.
I asked Youth J if she knew a Vista Maria staff person named
Staff 1. She said she did not. She could not concentrate on my
words and appeared to be responding to internal stimuli. I asked
Youth J if she recalled a Vista Maria staff sitting with her at the
2

hospital and saying something on the order of “if Youth J had hit
her, she would be on the floor.” Youth J asked, “What?” as if she
was unable to focus on the question. Youth J visibly strained to
concentrate on my words, and I asked the question again very
deliberately focusing on her eyes. This time she responded, “Yes,
a staff said that. But a lot of people say that. It didn’t faze me.” I
asked Youth J if she viewed Staff 1’s statement as a threat. She
responded, “I didn’t feel threatened.” I asked Youth J if Staff 1
said or did anything inappropriate while she sat with Youth J at the
hospital. Youth J answered, “No.”
I interviewed Staff 1 with Rights Officer present. She has worked
at the facility for 11 months. When she was at the hospital
monitoring Youth J, Staff 1 said Youth J pushed her arm. “I didn’t
say if she had hit me, she’d be on the floor.” Staff 1 denied
threatening Youth J in any manner.
Analysis Crisis Screener stated Staff 1 made a hypothetical threat toward
Youth J. Youth J confirmed this but did not consider it a threat.
Staff 1 denied threatening Youth J in any way. It could not be
determined if Staff 1 made a hypothetical threat toward Youth J.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
